main event: A flaming object was sighted 55 miles west of Los Angeles, California, traveling from northwest to southeast at a high speed and fading to the southeast within 25 to 40 seconds. The object was observed by multiple airline pilots and military personnel, and it was suggested to be possibly a rocket or satellite by the operations officer.
interesting points: The object was described as being about 6 feet long and 3 feet high with an altitude of 27/1/8.
It emitted incandescent balls falling off to make a tail and was reported to have the size of twice the diameter of a full moon.
Multiple visual observations were made by different aircraft in the area, indicating that the sighting was not an isolated event.
The object disappeared at the horizon after traveling very fast from northwest to southeast.
There was no forecasted thunderstorms in the area during the sighting, ruling out natural atmospheric phenomena.
